title: Notch叫停玩家自制Minecraft电影《Birth of Man》
author: zhang624232848
txt_content:
本帖最后由 cyqsimon 于 2014-7-2 02:02 编辑 

——新闻本体

Markus Persson, better known as "Notch," has put an early termination to the fan-funded Minecraft movie, "The Birth of Man."
The movie, whichIGN reported yesterday was to be released for free in 2014, was planned "to tell an epic fantasy story that would stand alone on its own merit and set that story in the world of Minecraft," according to the film's Kickstarter page. The Kickstarter had set its goal at $600,000 USD.Notch wrote via Twitter that "[Mojang doesn't] allow half a million Kickstarters based on our IP without any deals in place."
翻译：
Markus Persson, 也就是大家熟知的"Notch,决定将一部玩家自制电影"The Birth of Man."扼杀于摇篮之中。

这部昨天IGN报道的电影原定于2014年免费公开发行。在本电影的Kickstarter页面上写道：电影旨在“将故事背景设在Minecraft世界中，并讲述一部精彩绝伦的传奇神话故事”。本项目的Kickstarter目标资金为60万美金。

Notch通过Twitter表示："(Mojang 不会)允许一个基于我们知识产权的50万规模的Kickstarter项目不跟我们签订任何协议就进行。"

In the project's description on the Kickstarter page, filmmaker Brandon Laatsch wrote, "Mojang has encouraged the Minecraft community to take certain creative license with the overall world of Minecraft. Taking from their cues, we saw a unique opportunity to step up to the plate and create something that we hope will be a distinctive and incredible epic film."

Laatsch is an experienced YouTuber and co-creator of the freddiew YouTube channel. IGN is awaiting a comment from Laatsch on the situation.

What do you think? Should Laatsch and Notch work toward some sort of agreement? Or is Notch being unreasonable?
翻译：

根据这个计划的Kickstarter页面，电影制作者Brandon Laatsch写道：“Mojang曾经鼓励Minecraft社群达成某种创意授权。根据他们的暗示，我们看到一个特殊的机遇。从而能让我们站到台前并且制作一个[至少我们希望]电影神作。”

Laastch是一位资深的Youtube UP主，并且是Freddiew的Youtube频道的联合创始人。IGN正在等待Laatsch对于此时的评论。

你怎么想？Laatsch和Notch应该向前进一步并达成什么协定吗？或者你觉得Notch不可理喻么？

——关于电影《Birth Of Man》

Birth of Man, a Minecraft film fusing live-action characters and CG environments, has taken to Kickstarter to fund its production. Helmed by YouTuber and Freddie Wong co-creator Brandon Laatsch, Birth of Man is scheduled for a December 2014 release. Laatsch is seeking $600,000 in crowdfunding to make the movie a reality.

"My past 4 years of creating shorts on the ‘freddiew’ channel has been largely a study on what it is that our generation wants to watch," Laatsch told IGN. "The majority of these shorts have been based either directly on a video game franchise or on general themes that repeatedly show up in video games.  After many iterations, my conclusion is that past film adaptations of games have betrayed the audience by diluting the content in order to reach a broader audience."
翻译：

[hide=1]《Birth Of Man》——一个融合了真人角色以及CG环境的Minecraft电影，拍摄方选择了Kickstarter来为其计划募资。本电影由Youtube两名UP主Freddie Wong以及Brandon Laatsch导演。《Birth Of Man》原计划于2014年12月发售。Laatsch正计划在Kickstarter上募资60W美金来为这部电影的拍摄铺平道路。

“我过去四年在'freddiew'频道上制作短剧的经验是为了研究我们这一代（的人）想要看什么。”Laatsch告诉IGN，“大多数这些短剧都是在游戏内经常出现的场景。在过去很久之后，我认为过去的这种对游戏的改变是对观众的亵渎，因为他们为了获取更多的观众淡化了内容。”

He continued, "Hollywood must do this in order to cover their massive budgets, and they continually hope that they’ll find the same magic formula that they found with comic book adaptations, where hardcore audiences and the masses can both enjoy them.  However, the feedback that I’ve gotten from the gamer culture is that the elements of my shorts that they latch onto the most are the elements that no mainstream audience could ever get, so it is essential to make a film that assumes that you are onboard with Minecraft."

For those who don't know much about the game itself, Laatsch expects Birth of Man to be approachable, but it won't spend time justifying why the world operates the way it does. "One of the best things about adapting a game that has no set story or character to film is that there is nothing missed story wise by not playing it. The story that Birth of Man tells will be understandable and exciting regardless of whether you have played the game or not."

Furthermore, Laatsch specifically wants to avoid "origin story syndrome," while giving fans what they want and expect. "The attitude towards this production is respectful to the game, just like Chris Nolan was respectful to the Batman source material."

Laatsch concludes his Kickstarter pitch by stating, "This will surely be the greatest challenge that my team and I have ever faced, but it's what we've been preparing for ever since we decided that we want to make movies."
翻译：

他还说，“好莱坞必须这样做以支持他们庞大的预算。他们还一直希望找到与漫画改编电影一样的灵丹妙药，同时满足核心玩家和一般观众。但是，我从游戏玩家群体得到的反馈是，他们在我的那些短片里最喜欢的那些元素，正是一般观众所难以参透的。所以对这部电影来说，最重要的是假设你已经是Minecraft玩家之一了。”

Laatsch希望《Birth Of Man》能够大众化，以方便那些对于游戏了解不多的人，但是这部电影并不会纠结于世间大道这类空泛的话题：“由于Minecraft这款游戏并没有什么背景或人设，所以对于没有玩这个游戏的玩家们来说，理解角色并不是一件难事儿。这部电影将讲述你完全可以理解的内容，无论你是否玩过这款游戏。”

Laatsch不仅仅想要在让观众能够在银幕上看到他们所期待看到的东，并且他想防止“原著综合症”这种情况的发生，“对于游戏原作（我们）的态度是尊敬，就像Chris Nolan对于蝙蝠侠原著那样。”他说。

Laatsch告诉记者们：“这（电影）绝对会是我和我的团队遇到过的最强挑战，但我们从决定制作这部电影开始就已经开始准备了。”
